makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to Alonso Miguel de Tovar, Spanish, 1678 - 1758

texts.textentryhtml:
This sheet was attributed to Alonso Miguel de Tovar (1678-1758) in "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2002," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 62 (2003): p. 123. Lisa A. Banner states that this drawing and its accompanying image of Saint Sebastian(2002-99) "shares the light application of wash and loose outlines of the figures of those saints by Pedro Núñes de Villavicencio (1635-1695)...[The] similarity in execution suggests the Princeton drawings may have been made around the same time for a religious client in Andalusia..."

Adapted from: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).
texts.remarks: 2019-5-10; Adapted from: Lisa A. Banner, Spanish Drawings in the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2012).

texts.textentryhtml: Mathias Polakovits, Paris and New York, stamp lower right [Lugt 3561]
